meanings.definition: A state of isolation or restricted access as a security measure.
meanings.sent1: During the lockdown, no one was allowed to enter or leave the building.
meanings.sent2: The school went into lockdown when there was a security threat.
meanings.sent3: The lockdown turned the office into a quiet and empty place.
meanings.sent4: The lockdown on the bank vault was so secure, even the toughest safecracker couldn't break it.
meanings.sent5: The lockdown made the area feel like a ghost town, with no one around.

meanings.definition: The act of confining prisoners to their cells, typically as a security measure.
meanings.sent1: The lockdown in the prison was necessary to maintain order among the inmates.
meanings.sent2: The lockdown of the cell block prevented any escape attempts by the prisoners.
meanings.sent3: During the lockdown, the prisoners had to spend more time in their cells than usual.
meanings.sent4: The lockdown of the jail cells was like putting a lid on a boiling pot.
meanings.sent5: The lockdown of the prison cells made the inmates feel trapped and restless.

meanings.definition: A temporary restriction on the movement of people or vehicles in a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The lockdown of the city streets was due to the parade taking place.
meanings.sent2: During the lockdown, traffic was redirected to alternative routes.
meanings.sent3: The lockdown of the road caused a traffic jam that lasted for hours.
meanings.sent4: The lockdown of the neighborhood made it feel like a quiet and peaceful oasis.
meanings.sent5: The lockdown of the area made it difficult for residents to go about their daily routines.
